description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Ipoh: Capture the Magic" â€” a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Ipoh: Capture the Magic

places.generalDescription: Ipoh Kallumalai Arulmigu Subramaniyar Temple, established in 1930, is a serene Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Murugan. Nestled near DR Seenivasagam Park and a limestone cliff, the temple offers a tranquil atmosphere for quiet reflection and appreciation of the natural surroundings. Visitors can capture breathtaking views from the terrace against the cliffs.

sources.snippet: Kallumalai Arulmigu Subramaniyar Temple is a Hindu temple founded in 1930 which is dedicated to Lord Murugan. If you come during January or February, you might have a chance to witness how the Hindu devotees celebrate Deepavali and Thaipusam, Especially during Thaipusam, there will be a parade with lots of â€˜kavadiâ€™ and chariots moving towards the temple. Do not miss such an interesting place to visit in Ipoh!
sources.shortName: 28 Interesting places in Ipoh, Malaysia [2022 Updated]

places.name: Ipoh Kallumalai Arulmigu Subramaniyar Temple

reviews.text: Such a lovely place. It was so peaceful and quiet. Had a short stay in ipoh and went to the temple for Friday prayers in the morning. If you're in ipoh you can visit this temple it is open to all (as long you're wearing appropriate clothing) you can visit the peacock sanctuary at the back or enjoy the breathtaking view the temple is surrounded in.

To visit it from the road side I had to cross railways and came trough back gates. There are many monkeys around but they did behave good. Small devi temple with Mahavidya goddesses are near. The temple itself represent South Indian tradition of Kartileya and Murugan devotion. Also big lingam statue was there near the roch and Mahadev statue up the rock with yogis. In front of lingam there is Shiv vahana of Nandi and small pound. And Hanuman ji statue little in front. Thereis some Indian settlement around
Temple is very pretty.. less people around.. very windy and conducive environment for praying. Though stray dogs coming inside the temple ðŸ˜”

places.address: 140, Jalan Raja Musa Aziz, 30300 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Gua Kek Look Tong is a limestone cave temple situated on 12 acres of land, featuring intricate Buddha sculptures and a serene garden with a reflexology footpath. Located in Gunung Rapat near other famous limestone caves like Sam Poh Tong, the area also offers traditional coconut shell-broiled Heong Peng biscuits with a delightful molten filling.

sources.snippet: With a massive cave formation, interesting geological features, and a serene garden surrounded by limestone hills, Kek Lok Tong Temple just might be the best place to visit in Ipoh. Whereas the Perak Tong Cave Temple takes pride in its beautiful views after a strenuous hike, seeing the best of Kek Lok Tong requires minimal effort. As you enter through the massive opening, you will be immediately greeted by religious artifacts, stalactites, and stalagmites.
sources.shortName: 25+ BEST Things To Do In Ipoh: Top Attractions Of 2024

sources.snippet: A natural attraction that is very popular in Ipoh Old Town because here there is a Buddhist temple in a cave & the concept of a tourist destination here is more or less the same as in Batu Caves. The sight of the stalactite/stalagmite structure in the cave here is really impressive & estimated to be thousands of years old. Although this destination is more of a Buddhist holy place, there is no obstacle for tourists to come and visit here.
sources.shortName: Attractions - 1969 Business Suites

sources.snippet: Located in the natural area of Gunung Rapat in Ipoh, the Kek Lok Tong Cave Temple is one of the most prominent tourist attractions for its incredible architecture and award-winning garden. The temple has some similarities with Perak Cave Temple and Sam Poh Tong, such as bronze statues, religious relics, landscape, and so on. You can experience spiritual tranquillity in the environment of this temple.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh

places.name: Kek Lok Tong Cave Temple

reviews.text:
Updated: temporary closure due to flooded since Oct 2024 till today (20/3/25)
Further notice to be announced.

As a tourist, I really recommended to this cave (gua). Peaceful with serene environment.

Some activities available here, self cycle duck boat & bi-bicycle, wishing tree, massage stone walkway, feeding fish in the big pond. No ticket entry charge but may donate some for maintenance.

Awesome view enter into cave then came out from the cave with a pond view. Water drop naturally flow from top of cave. Suggest to come before noon time.

Visited Kek Lok Tong last year (31/8/2024), this temple is built inside a massive limestone cave with stunning rock formations and a peaceful atmosphere. You'll find a beautiful garden at the back with a pond and walking paths.

The entrance is free, and there's ample parking. Entire area is clean and well-maintained. It's suitable for families, solo travelers, and couples who enjoy nature and culture. A must-visit spot in Ipoh - great for sightseeing, photography, and some quiet reflection.

One of the most beautiful cave I've been in Malaysia. The stalagmites and stalactites formations are so incredible. It has temple inside where locals and tourists can visit. At the back it has garden and lake and also a river that you can do boating. I love how they took care of the cave. It was worth to visit if you're nature lover. It's really good for the eye the surrounding green. It was so clean and well maintained.

places.address: PERSIARAN SEPAKAT 3, TMN ENDAH JAYA, 31350 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Nestled in a valley of limestone mountains, Mirror Lake is a secluded and stunning spot accessible through a tunnel cut by miners. Surrounded by limestone cliffs and rainforest, the clear waters of the lake reflect the natural beauty that encircles it. Referred to as Malaysia's First Eco Adventure Quarry Park, this picturesque location offers reflective lakes, colossal cliffs, and lush landscapes. Despite being closed to visitors at present, Mirror Lake remains an enchanting destination for those seeking tranquility amidst breathtaking scenery.

sources.snippet: Beyond the gorgeous cityscape, Ipoh also offers off-the-beaten adventures and scenic views. Nestled among the limestone karst hills of Gunung Rapat is a mystical and idyllic lake. The stillness of the lake and the glistening reflection of the rugged limestone walls, shrubs, and sunlight on the water â€” hence the name â€” give a sense of calm and serenity.
sources.shortName: Get to The Latest Instagrammable Spots in Ipoh with Mitsubishi Outlander

places.name: Mirror Lake

reviews.text: Beautiful scenic place, the man made lake was smaller than I thought. A boat tour is a must to fully enjoy the " mirror " effect.

This spot is truly unique. Stunning views and a great spot for photography. It's a worthwhile experience that one might consider for a once-in-a-lifetime visit.

A solid 4 stars!

The entrance were quite run down n most of not all the man make facilities were in "ruin" and in desperate need of maintenance, lucky the lake didn't disappoint (it was WOW) however hopefully whoever managing it is taking proactive steps to take care of the fragile ecosystem there.

places.generalDescription: D R Seenivasagam Recreational Park, located in Ipoh and overlooking the Kinta River, is a fantastic destination for families and travelers alike. The park offers lush picnic areas, sports fields, and a small lake with charming bridges. Visitors can take leisurely strolls along the pathways adorned with water ponds and green spaces while enjoying the shade of beautiful trees.

sources.snippet: With its pollution, noise and traffic, Ipoh is a city that can easily tire you out, especially if you are visiting with kids. If that is the case, why not take a step back and check out the DR Seenivasagam Recreational Park?. Located north of the city center, it is a place where you can properly relax and be with nature.
sources.shortName: 25+ BEST Things To Do In Ipoh: Top Attractions Of 2024

sources.snippet: Dr. Seenivasagam Park is located in Negeri Perak and is a prominent recreational park for the people in the city. The main highlight of the park is the Japanese Mini Garden that creates an illusion among visitors that they are actually in Japan.
sources.shortName: 33 Best Places to visit in Ipoh | Top Tourist Attractions
The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh
25 Places to Visit in Ipoh, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

places.name: D R Seenivasagam Recreational Park

reviews.text:
A nice place to have some brisk walk with family and friends. The best things is this place are last minute decision for our company getaway, and its really great experience.

They got lot of space for our picnic activities, many spots for ootd, a small nice field for some telematch. The best part is they also have Boat ride and Train, which the staff there really helpful (We got discount from themðŸ«£). Really suit to bring family and friends here

It's the oldest park in Ipoh, offers a peaceful retreat with its lush greenery and tranquil atmosphere. It's perfect for a relaxing stroll, jog, or a quiet escape. However, some areas were rundown and show signs of neglect that could use better upkeep.

Nice medium sized park. Fairly clean. Large paddle boats for rent on a small lake. Some gondolas on the bridges to sit and relax in the shade. A large soccer field and a place for skateboarders. A nice playground for kids, bathrooms, snack shops, and a train ride. Plenty of picnic benches scattered around the park and along the river there's a nice path to walk on and a few restaurants, stores for gifts and toys, and a bumper car ride. I was there on a Wed morning and most of everything was closed until the afternoon.

places.address: Jalan Keliling Dalam, 30300 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Qing Xin Ling Leisure & Cultural Village, also known as Serene Hill, is a charming natural area that seamlessly blends cultural displays with recreational activities. Nestled amidst Ipoh's famous limestone hills and lakes, this village offers a glimpse into Chinese Malaysian heritage through traditional architecture, artifacts, antiques, and sculptures. Visitors can enjoy hikes and biking while immersing themselves in the rich cultural exhibits on display.

sources.snippet: Known as the â€˜Serene Hillâ€™ in Mandarin, this scenic park is a literal time machine that brings you back to the past with its nostalgic theme and is surrounded by limestone hills and caves. Its art installations and paintings are the main highlights of this place as it shows you some stuff that no longer exists. Your grandparents will surely enjoy this place, making it a good place for a family trip.
sources.shortName: 10 Insta-worthy Spots In Ipoh You Should Check Out

sources.snippet: The Qing Xin Ling Leisure & Cultural Village is an eco-tourist spot 20-minute drive away from Ipoh town. It has been carefully preserved to turn a patch of wilderness into a brilliant attraction. Nestled amid sky-high cliffs of limestone hills covered in lush forests, the village features emerald-green lakes, cute koi ponds, and lots of tiny lakeside cottages to sit and enjoy nature.
sources.shortName: 33 Best Places to visit in Ipoh | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: Located in Gunung Rapat, Qing Xin Ling Leisure & Cultural Village has become one of the finest and latest tourist attractions for its lakeside beauty and outdoor activities. The words â€˜Qing Xing Lingâ€™ mean â€˜Serene Hillâ€™ in English. Youâ€™ll be amazed by the view of magnificent limestones surrounding all over the lake.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh

sources.snippet: Stepping into the place, youâ€™d probably feel like as if youâ€™ve travelled in time to a place in the past, perhaps in China. With the buildings and art installations, the park blooms in a nostalgia theme. Not forgetting to mention, itâ€™s built around an emerald lake, surrounded by limestone hills and caves.
sources.shortName: 10 Beautiful Spots In Ipoh Worth Travelling The Miles For

sources.snippet: Temporarily closed â€“ a tragic accident resulting in the death of one person has caused the park to close temporarily while investigation and safety measures are being made. Admission isnâ€™t free but you get to use their bicycles and straw hats!. We recommend taking the bicycles.
sources.shortName: Instagram Worthy Spots In Ipoh For A Memorable Time And Photo

sources.snippet: This place is a hidden gem that offers lots of photo opportunities!. Plus, thereâ€™s a scenic lakeside that gives you that vibe of being in China when in reality, youâ€™re in Ipoh!. This village has an abundance of vintage art murals and paintings, giving it a nostalgic charm.
sources.shortName: Ipoh Isn't Just Famous for Food, Here are 7 Stunning Places That'll Slay Your Insta Feed

sources.snippet: There are free bicycles to ride around, a big pond in the middle, surrounded by rocky hills. If you love antiques, there are exhibits of old stuff such as old music record posters, typewriters, and gasoline lamps. Find it here: Qing Xin Ling Leisure & Cultural Village
sources.shortName: 32 Stunning Instagram Spots in Ipoh (With Exact Location!)

sources.snippet: It is one of the finest and latest tourist attractions in ipoh. The words Qing Xin Ling means serene hills. At a very minimal cost, you will be transported to a different planet to discover.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Ipoh, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Majestic limestone hills and a picturesque lake make up the scenery here. Visitors can ride a bike, feed the fish, and visit the vintage exhibitions there!
sources.shortName: 21 Best Things To Do In Ipoh (Places That You Shouldn't Miss!)

places.name: Qing Xin Ling Leisure & Cultural Village

reviews.text:
This place is an absolute gem for tourists! I had an incredible time exploring it. The area is steeped in rich culture, and hiking the small hill was such a unique experience, especially with all the antiques scattered along the trail. The scenery is breathtaking, with a serene lake and fascinating caves to discover. The murals on the walls add an artistic charm to the surroundings, making the walk even more enjoyable.

For those who prefer cycling, there are shared bicycles available, which is a thoughtful touch and perfect for soaking in the beauty of the place at your own pace.

Overall, it's a stunning destination and definitely worth the visit. Highly recommend experiencing this at least once!

Really enjoyed this place and definitely think it's worth a visit, entrance fee is 12RM for locals or 20RM for foreigners. Spent about about 1.5 - 2 hours looking around, you also have the option of using bikes to bike around which are free of charge (so much fun ) and if it's to hot for you they also have hats you can use as long as you return to when you got from. Enjoyed looking round the different areas. You can purchase bags of fish food for 1RM to feed as you walk around In he lakes, also saw a turtle.

Amazing place for tourist, we had a great time here, it's very rich in culture and great experience to be hiking a small hill with a lot of antiques on the side of the hill. We can walk around the lake and caves, there were some murals on the side.There's even a shared bicycle provided for anyone who wants to ride along the way.

Overall really worth the experience and a beautiful place. Would recommend to come at least once.

places.address: 22A, Persiaran Pinggir Rapat 5a, Taman Saikat, 31350 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Perak Cave Temple, also known as Perak Tong, is a stunning Buddhist temple situated on a picturesque hill in Malaysia. Founded in 1926 by Chinese Buddhist immigrants, the temple boasts intricate murals, grand altars, and a towering golden Buddha statue. Visitors can climb over 400 steps to reach the hilltop and enjoy breathtaking views. The cave system within the temple offers an intriguing exploration experience for travelers.

sources.snippet: With over 30 caves temples around Ipoh,  it might be different to pick the perfect one. If you had to choose one for your  Ipoh itinerary, then  Perak Tong Cave Temple (or Kek Lok Tong Cave Temple) has to be the one. Featuring intricate cave formations, exquisite religious artifacts and paintings, and a stunning panoramic view (after a short hike) of Perak, this Ipoh cave temple has everything a tourist might be looking for.
sources.shortName: 25+ BEST Things To Do In Ipoh: Top Attractions Of 2024

sources.snippet: Perak Cave Temple will impress you with its marvellous architecture and hilltop views. After entering the temple, the first thing that will catch your attention is the 40-feet tall gold Buddha statue and guardian deities at both sides of this statue. Follow the 400 steps to enjoy this magical environment.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh

sources.snippet: Perak Tong Cave Temple is one of the most famous tourist attractions in Ipoh. Surrounded by the scenic landscape this cave fast first discovered in 1926. Since then the place has grown to be known amongst the best cave temples and famous tourist spots.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Ipoh, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Perak Tong is one of the most beautiful cave temples in Malaysia. It was discovered by Chong Sen Yee and his wife â€“ Choong Chan Yoke â€“ in 1926. Since then, they developed the Perak Tong cave temple using donations from local and international donors.
sources.shortName: 28 Interesting places in Ipoh, Malaysia [2022 Updated]

places.name: Perak Cave Temple

reviews.text:
A must visit place while you in Ipoh. Prepare your self to get on top. Climb a very steep stairs. Bring your own waters, there is no water supply on top. The climbing gate open from 8 am- 4 pm.  Free entry.

This is a Buddhist temple, but it was opened for public. Just respect for their culture.

It was easy to get there using the grab from the city. It costs around 15RM. The temple was located in the countryside so there was nothing near there. You can enjoy the temple in the cave without a fee. You can also enjoy the view of the top and can see the whole Ipoh city but it was not huge than I expected. If you visit Ipoh, you have to visit here to enjoy the cave temple and many monkeys.

Impressive cave temple with multiple galleries and levels. A set of very steep and narrow stairs leads to the top of the cliffs with rewarding views across Ipoh. This climb is not for the faint hearted. Suggest not to attempt this walk during the midday heat. Take water.

places.address: Jln. Kuala Kangsar, Kawasan Perindustrian Tasek, 31400 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Sam Poh Tong Temple is a renowned limestone cave temple that dates back to 1953. It sits on a 12-acre site and was used as a place of worship as early as 1920. The temple is located in a huge cave within the limestone outcrops behind Gunung Rapat and features a central altar with Buddhist figures and Chinese deities. The caves offer a unique garden view inside, and the surrounding landscape includes jogging paths, lakes, and reflexology footpaths.

sources.snippet: Sam Poh Tong Cave Temple  gained its recognition for being the oldest and the main cave temple in Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia. It is also known as the largest cave in Malaysia and contains a wide variety of artifacts including the reclining Buddha statue. However, the temple is starting to lose its glory as fewer and fewer donations are received annually to maintain it.
sources.shortName: 25+ BEST Things To Do In Ipoh: Top Attractions Of 2024

sources.snippet: Ipohâ€™s oldest (and highly photogenic) limestone cave temple can be found in Gunung Rapat along with some other temples. At the front of the temple is a beautiful garden and pond and you may well spend a few minutes here!. Your very first up and close look of Sam Poh Tong will be the grand archway before the temple entrance.
sources.shortName: Instagram Worthy Spots In Ipoh For A Memorable Time And Photo

sources.snippet: A famous cave temple located in Gunung Rapa, Sam Poh Tong Cave is an inspiring work of art and is believed to be the largest cave temple of the country. Set amidst the scenic beauty, the temple consists of numerous Buddha statues and figures of other deities scattered all over the cave among the limestone formation.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Ipoh, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Sam Poh Tong Cave Temple, situated in Gunung Rapat, is a cluster of three Chinese limestone cave temples adorned with natural and manmade artistic attractions. Ling Sen Tong, Nam Thean Tong, and Sam Poh Tong are the three temples. The oldest and main cave temple in Ipoh; it affords a spectacular view of the town.
sources.shortName: 33 Best Places to visit in Ipoh | Top Tourist Attractions

sources.snippet: The Sam Poh Tong Temple is the largest such cave temple in Malaysia and also the most visited. Climb the 240 steps to the entrance and youâ€™ll be rewarded with mesmerizing views of Gunung Rapat. Nearby, thereâ€™s the Ling Sen Tong Temple with a gigantic statue of the Buddha and the Nam Thean Tong Temple.
sources.shortName: Top Things To Do In Ipoh, Malaysia's Hipster Hotspot

sources.snippet: A short 10-minute drive from the town is the extraordinary Gunung Rapat Limestone Hills, which are home to many temples. One of the most interesting is the Sam Poh Tong Cave Temple, a beautiful Chinese Buddhist temple built into the limestone. Book a tour and discover the best of Ipoh.
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 9 Best Things To Do in Ipoh, Malaysia (Updated 2025)

sources.snippet: Sam Poh Tong is the oldest cave temple in Ipoh and the largest cave temple in Malaysia. In 1890, a Chinese Buddhist monk explored this cave and lived there till the end of his life. After his death, other monks continued to stay there and built a temple in the 1950s.
sources.shortName: 28 Interesting places in Ipoh, Malaysia [2022 Updated]

sources.snippet: Ever thought of taking a photo in front of a hidden temple in a forest?. Well, the Sam Poh Tong cave temple is the perfect place to be. Located about 5KM from the city center, Sam Poh Tong cave temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Ipoh.
sources.shortName: 32 Stunning Instagram Spots in Ipoh (With Exact Location!)

sources.snippet: Sam Poh Tong is one of the oldest and largest limestone cave temples in Malaysia. This temple will impress you from both the inside and outside. You have to follow the 246 steps to visit the statues of Buddha and other deities.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh

sources.snippet: Out of the countless temples and caves available in Ipoh, Sam Poh Tong stands out as temple you absolutely must visit.
sources.shortName: 10 Beautiful Spots In Ipoh Worth Travelling The Miles For

places.name: Sam Poh Tong Temple

reviews.text: It was a truly beautiful place. The view was amazing, and I loved feeding the fish in the pond â€“ it was so calming. The whole atmosphere was incredibly peaceful, making it perfect for a family outing, whether you're looking for a quiet place to reflect or just a relaxing day trip.  And the tortoises?  A charming bonus!

It's temple in the cave. Actually I went there around 1:50pm, but already closed in the firat day, so 2nd day, I went there at 8am. Then finally I could get in. However turtle ponds were opened around 8:30am. It looks nice, but the turtle pond was the best place where you have to chec and see. It's divine.
Very quiet and spiritual place.. the landscape, artifacts and rocks are amazing.. you can buy food to feeding the fish and the turtle here

places.address: Kampung Gunung Rapat, 31350 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: The Birch Memorial Clock Tower, erected in 1909 as a tribute to James W.W. Birch, the inaugural British Resident of Perak, stands as a significant historical landmark offering insights into the colonial history of Perak. The tower features four distinct panels depicting the evolution of civilization from the Stone Age to the Renaissance.

sources.snippet: The Birch Memorial Clock Tower in Ipoh was erected in 1909 to commemorate James Wheeler Whoodford Birch â€“ the 1st British Resident in Perak. He was assassinated by Dato Maharaja Lela (a local Malay) 1 year after his inauguration as a British Resident due to his lack of respect for local customs causing a resistance movement of the locals. Though he is considered a hero to the British.
sources.shortName: 28 Interesting places in Ipoh, Malaysia [2022 Updated]

sources.snippet: Birch Memorial Clock Tower is a beautiful white and black structure which was constructed in 1909 as a memorial for J.W.W.Birch, who was the first resident in the city. Birch was assassinated by Datuk Maharaja Lela, a local chief in 1875. On the top of the tower are four whitewashed figures, symbolizing the four virtues of British government.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Ipoh, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Birch Memorial Clock is named after James W W Birch, the first British resident in Ipoh. The tower is placed just behind the Ipoh Old Post Office, over a renowned hawker centre. This colonial architecture is famous for its controversial history and carries British symbolism.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh

sources.snippet: This spot is really popular amongst Instagrammers and photographers alike. This colonial era clock tower was built in 1909 in memory of Perakâ€™s first British Resident, James WW Birch. Thereâ€™s actually quite a bit of history and controversy behind it.
sources.shortName: 10 Insta-worthy Spots In Ipoh You Should Check Out

sources.snippet: The steps leading to this exquisite white tower are the most popular spot among photographers and Instagrammers. No matter the time of the day, the tower is always in its best form for your pictures. Find it here: Birch Memorial Tower, 31650 Ipoh
sources.shortName: 32 Stunning Instagram Spots in Ipoh (With Exact Location!)

sources.snippet: Birch Memorial - Erected in 1909, this clock tower stands across from the Ipoh State Mosque - a memorial to J.W.W Birch (First British Resident of Perak)
sources.shortName: 21 Best Things To Do In Ipoh (Places That You Shouldn't Miss!)

places.name: Birch Memorial Clock Tower

reviews.text: The highlight is the iconic Birch Memorial Clock Tower, which stands as a tribute to J.W.W. Birch, the first British Resident of Perak. The park offers a quiet spot for a short stroll or to reflect on the colonial history of the area. While not a large attraction, it's worth a quick visit if you're exploring the heritage trail in Ipoh.

**A Tower of Time and Reflection â€“ Visiting the Birch Memorial in Ipoh**

Standing before the Birch Memorial Clock Tower in Ipoh feels like stepping into a page of history. Built in 1909 to honor James W.W. Birch, the first British Resident of Perak, the tower is a striking relic of colonial architecture. Located near the Ipoh State Mosque, it rises with Victorian grace, capped with a clock on all four sides and topped with a weather vane.

What makes this tower especially unique are the elaborate panels at its base. They depict 44 notable figures-from Confucius to Darwin-marking the evolution of human civilization. At the top, four statues represent core virtues: prudence, justice, fortitude, and temperance, a symbolic reminder of values that transcend time.

Being here stirred a real sense of appreciation. It's more than just stone and symbolism-it's a lens into our shared, complex past. I truly hope more people, especially the younger generation, take the time to visit and learn from this monument. It's a piece of heritage that deserves to be remembered, talked about, and preserved.

Appreciate you stopping by! For more travel tales, hidden spots, and behind-the-scenes bites from places like this, hop over to my profile - the journey continues there.

If u wanna come here, better start your trip from concubine lane 2. More easy to cross the road.

Got many new and nice mural@wall painting for check-in@selfie purposes.

Come early morning for nice view and cool fresh air.

places.generalDescription: Gunung Lang Recreational Park is a serene and spacious park in Ipoh, offering a tranquil atmosphere with its beautiful lake, boat rides, and manmade waterfall. Families visiting Ipoh should consider this park as one of the top attractions, providing ample green spaces, lush trees, and picturesque water ponds for leisurely walks and quality time with loved ones. The park also offers numerous areas to relax and unwind amidst nature's beauty.

sources.snippet: For those of you who want a day tour near Ipoh, Gunung Lang Recreational Park is the perfect destination for them. Located just 5km away from Ipoh, it is a recreation park with facilities like boating, canoeing, pacifying in the gazebos, fishing, and so on. The best part of this park is that it is set between two mighty limestone mountains Gunung Lang and Gunung Bilike.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh

sources.snippet: Only located about 6 km from Ipoh Old Town, this recreational park is an interesting place in Ipoh that is suitable for those who like relaxing activities in natural areas. In this destination there is a very beautiful lake and garden landscape and surrounded by views of limestone hills. Tourists can take a boat for sightseeing and recreation in the playground provided.
sources.shortName: Attractions - 1969 Business Suites

sources.snippet: Gunung Lang Recreational Park is a detour from the North-South Express highway,  but you can also get there from Ipoh town via  Jalan Kuala Kangsar. The peaceful scenery is reason enough to go. There is also a man-made waterfall by the Gunung Lang sign but itâ€™s not always on.
sources.shortName: Instagram Worthy Spots In Ipoh For A Memorable Time And Photo

sources.snippet: A post shared by Mohammad Zulkifli (@zkyzsz) on Sep 12, 2017 at 7:16am PDT. Originally a waste mine lake, which is later developed as a park. This park boasts an 80-meter-high artificial waterfall which water falls from the top of the hill.
sources.shortName: Boost Your IG Account With Beautiful Photos at these Gorgeous Spots in Ipoh

sources.snippet: Quiet and slightly further from the busy town, Gunung Lang is a lovely place to enjoy a cold breeze since itâ€™s located beside a jungle. Thereâ€™s a 2-minute boat ride to the other side of the lake. Enjoy the scenic view and greeneries here.
sources.shortName: 32 Stunning Instagram Spots in Ipoh (With Exact Location!)

sources.snippet: To get to Gunung Lang Recreational Park, visitors need to take a scenic boat ride to cross the lake. The artificial waterfall on top of a limestone hill at the entrance is another highlight!
sources.shortName: 21 Best Things To Do In Ipoh (Places That You Shouldn't Miss!)

sources.snippet: If youâ€™re a nature lover, then you should not miss going to Gunung Lang in Ipoh. This place is a tourist spot and is famous for its beautiful green scenery. Landscapes are beautiful here!.
sources.shortName: Ipoh Isn't Just Famous for Food, Here are 7 Stunning Places That'll Slay Your Insta Feed

sources.snippet: Situated only five kilometers from Ipoh town, the recreational park features a beautiful lake and breathtaking views. Address: Jalan Damai, 30100 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia
sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal - Singapore's Leading Travel and Lifestyle Portal
sources.shortName: 14 Unknown Instagrammable Locations In Ipoh For The Perfect #POTD

places.name: Gunung Lang Recreational Park

reviews.text: A scenic limestone park and lake. There is a boat ride to get you to another park across the lake. Tickets need to be bought cash only. A lot of wild monkeys so don't bring any food on this trip. Even at the jetty there are many monkeys harassing people. Boat ride take you to another park with some Malay buildings, watchtower and abandoned attractions. Wheelchair is accessible but with great difficulties and need some people to help. Staffs are not there 24/7 to help.

Adult rm3, elderly rm1.50.

Nice place to walk around. Just the place not much maintenance, many dried leaf~ No animal now, but got a lot monkey, so just be careful.

Got people there use editing backgrounds take photo and sell photo, I think this can be improve, have a nice natural place, just make the place nicer, will be more gorgeous~

I love this place despite people mentioned it being mediocre and boring. The boat ride is rm 3 and quite spacious to walk around (30 min to 1 hour), many places in the island is photogenic and beautiful but very stuffy and humid in there. There is an abandoned campsite at the West from the boat loading point, can be adventurous but be careful if your sixth sense is off, leave the campsite immediately. Have fun exploring the park!

places.generalDescription: Perak Guanyin Cave, also known as Kwan Yin Tong, is an ancient Buddhist temple located beside a limestone hill in Ipoh. The temple is surrounded by religious relics and statues, manicured landscapes, and architectural splendor. It covers over 12 acres of land and has been a place of worship for Buddhism for around 100 years. Visitors can admire the statues dedicated to the Goddess of Mercy before entering the cave temple.

sources.snippet: To the south is the Guanyin Cave where there is a temple dedicated to the Goddess of Mercy, Kwan Yin Tong. A visit to the cave temples is a must on any things to do in Ipoh list.
sources.shortName: Top Things To Do In Ipoh, Malaysia's Hipster Hotspot

places.name: Perak Guanyin Cave

reviews.text: Amazing temple with lots to see. It's incredibly well taken care of and I'd recommend making the journey if you're staying anywhere in Ipoh. I'd be careful if it's raining as it can get a bit slippy however their are some non slip mats in the actual cave but if you decide to climb up to look around it gets very steep with small and some uneven steps so remember to be careful would definitely come again l.

It's temple in the cave. I was so surprised for the number of the buddhist statues. They have many size and materials are different. It really looks divine. I didn't target to this locarion, but I just luckily stopped by. It was good luck for me.

A beautiful cave temple below a limestone hill. The big cavern has a cool and calm atmosphere. Devotees can have a peaceful time praying inside. There are many Buddha and Guanyin statues of different sizes inside. The surrounding garden outside the temple has many Buddhist statues too. Great place to sit and enjoy the serenity of the  surrounding areas of the temple.

places.generalDescription: Mural Art's Lane in Ipoh New Town is a vibrant outdoor gallery that showcases stunning murals painted on the back walls of historic heritage houses. Initiated by local art teacher Eric Lai, these captivating artworks celebrate the rich tapestry of Malaysian culture, featuring scenes like traditional dances and playful children at play. As you explore this artistic lane, donâ€™t forget to take advantage of the Mitsubishi Outlanderâ€™s sunroof for an enhanced view while soaking up natural light during your mural-hunting adventure.

sources.snippet: You donâ€™t need to make your way to a museum or gallery to admire amazing art pieces â€” just look out the window and see an abundance of them adorning the cityâ€™s walls, peopling alleys that wrap around the city. Soak in the views and see Ipoh from different angles with the Mitsubishi Outlanderâ€™s sunroof, which also brings some lovely natural light into the car. These murals make great Instagram photo backdrops, so you can even make an adventure out of mural-hunting and photo-taking.
sources.shortName: Get to The Latest Instagrammable Spots in Ipoh with Mitsubishi Outlander

sources.snippet: Mural Art Laneâ€™s paintings in Ipoh were created mainly by Ernest Zacharevic under the sponsorship of Oldtown White Coffee. The mural arts were incorporated with real figures such as windows, doors making it more interesting and lively. Address: Jalan Masjid, Taman Jubilee, 30300 Ipoh, Perak
sources.shortName: 28 Interesting places in Ipoh, Malaysia [2022 Updated]

sources.snippet: In Ipohâ€™s new town, thereâ€™s a street named Mural Lane where you can see some amazing artwork depicting local life, cultures, festivals, and traditions. If you love chasing murals, you must also visit George Town in Penang on your Malaysia trip.
sources.shortName: Top Things To Do In Ipoh, Malaysia's Hipster Hotspot

sources.snippet: The Mural Arts Lane is an overlooked outdoor gallery for hidden talent and street art enthusiasts. Address: Jalan Masjid, Taman Jubilee, 30300 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia
sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal - Singapore's Leading Travel and Lifestyle Portal
sources.shortName: 14 Unknown Instagrammable Locations In Ipoh For The Perfect #POTD

places.name: Mural Art's Lane

reviews.text:
It was my first visit and whilst I did see murals that have faded over time, I still think this place is worth a visit. The trees and plants growing near some of the murals, added a fair amount of charm to it. It was very quiet as there were only the 2 of us visiting the time we did. Whilst it felt safe, I can appreciate that individuals visiting on their own may feel hesitant. So, worth coming along with someone.

I enjoyed seeing how each mural represented the different cultural aspects and expressions of Malaysia. I do think that it would be great for the local/ state government have some focus in preserving a number of the murals.

I would visit this place again. Mornings when the temperature is cooler is definitely a recommended time.

The quiet lane has many mural arts on the wall although it looks old, color faded and not well maintained like other places. But you can find the arts are rich in culture with multi races tradition which cannot find in other places.

It's street with wall art. There are many arts, but not everythings are artistic. Aome of them were awsome, but some of them were immature looking. I cannot say the actual "Art", but as amature, I felt something by some of them, but I didn't feel anything from some of them.

places.address: Jalan Masjid, Taman Jubilee, 30300 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Nam Thean Tong Temple, also known as Nan Tian Tong, is a 19th-century Taoist cave temple located between Ling Sen Tong and Sam Poh Tong Temples. It is renowned for its colorful shrines, including red pillars, yellow-tiled Chinese roofs, and blue walls. The temple features life-sized cartoon-like statues at the entrance and is famous for its painting of the Eight Immortals over the temple entrance.

sources.snippet: Nearby, thereâ€™s the Ling Sen Tong Temple with a gigantic statue of the Buddha and the Nam Thean Tong Temple. All three can be reached on buses T34 and T37 that run from Medan Kidd. The Kek Lok Tong Temple is located in one of the most majestic caves in the region; it is located further to the east and youâ€™ll have to book a Grab to get there.
sources.shortName: Top Things To Do In Ipoh, Malaysia's Hipster Hotspot

places.name: Nam Thean Tong Temple

reviews.text: 3 temples side by side on a short road. Short grab ride from cbd. Free to visit.  Each slightly different.  Well worth the visit if you've got couple hours.

Visited on weekday 8am.
No one is around yet. A tour bus visited around 830am.
Quiet, peaceful, birds chirping,  dogs barking.
You can walk around inside and outside. There are seats to rest and chill.
Took 20 mins to appreciate the place and just chilled there while waiting for the other temples to open.
It's temple in the cave. It was really located in the cave. The inside is big enough to feel something.

places.generalDescription: Sunway Lost World Theme Park offers a unique experience with its natural mineral hot springs that glow at night in a jungle setting. The park also features a petting zoo and bistro for visitors to enjoy. While the area is generally quiet at night, it's important to keep valuables close due to occasional snatch thefts. Despite being on the pricier side, the park provides an enjoyable way for families to spend time together after dark.

sources.snippet: Located in Ipoh, Malaysia, Lost World Hot Springs and Night Park is a theme park known for its rides and attractions. The park is divided into two zones namely the theme parks and the night park. The park comes with more than 80 rides worth trying out and are made safe for people across all ages.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Ipoh, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: If youâ€™d like a place to do nothing after a long day, enjoy soaking in some hot steamy water to relax!
sources.shortName: 15 Things To Do in Ipoh (Morning till Night)

places.name: Sunway Lost World Theme Park : Hot Springs & Night Park

reviews.text: It's refreshing and relaxing to enjoy the hot pools. It's a great experience and lots of walking. Hahah. Spacious and worth your money.
Decent theme park for the price with awesome view around. Can spend 4-5 hours of fun time with family and friends. Place isn't crowded so short to no waiting and few rides only.

We really enjoyed our visit to this theme park, especially the hot spring pool-it was the best part for us, as we could relax in the warm water after a day of fun. Surprisingly, we also loved their mini zoo. They had a wide variety of animals like capybaras, ponies, zebras, giraffes, hippos, and guinea pigs. Our favorite was the bird zone, where you could walk inside a giant aviary and interact closely with the birds. They also have a tiger feeding show in the afternoon. However, just like many other theme parks in Malaysia, the park was super hot in the afternoon, the food options were limited and overpriced, and some water pools didn't seem very hygienic.

places.address: 1, Persiaran Lagun Sunway 1, Sunway City Ipoh, 31150 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Ling Sen Tong Temple is a Taoist cave temple located in a lush setting, featuring colorful statues and a subterranean sanctuary. It sits on a 12-acre site and has been used as a place of worship since the 1920s. The temple is set within a huge cave in the limestone outcrops behind Gunung Rapat and comprises a central altar with Buddhist figures and Chinese deities. The unique feature of the caves includes another great garden view once inside.

sources.snippet: Located at the bottom of a limestone hill in Ipoh, Ling Sen Tong temple is a magnificent Taoist cave temple. Decorated with various statues of deities, animals and other Chinese folklore characters amidst the stalagmites and stalactites, this temple boasts of a majestic structure. It has a number of praying alters scattered all over the temple complex.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Ipoh, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Ling Sen Tong Temple is situated on the foot of a limestone hill, so it doesnâ€™t exactly fit the definition of a â€œcave templeâ€. Ling Sen Tong is the home to many colorful and carefully crafted statues, all located inside a medium-sized garden. There is no physical activity that needs to be done, unlike Perak Cave Temple or Sam Tong Poh Temple.
sources.shortName: 25+ BEST Things To Do In Ipoh: Top Attractions Of 2024

sources.snippet: Nearby, thereâ€™s the Ling Sen Tong Temple with a gigantic statue of the Buddha and the Nam Thean Tong Temple. All three can be reached on buses T34 and T37 that run from Medan Kidd. The Kek Lok Tong Temple is located in one of the most majestic caves in the region; it is located further to the east and youâ€™ll have to book a Grab to get there.
sources.shortName: Top Things To Do In Ipoh, Malaysia's Hipster Hotspot

sources.snippet: Ling Sen Tong is a Taoist â€“ Buddhist temple nested at the foot of a limestone hill in Gunung Rapat, Ipoh. From the outside, you will be amazed by its beautifully colourful design with many statues of deities, animals and other characters from Chinese mythology. The temple is very close to Kek Lok Tong cave temple.
sources.shortName: 28 Interesting places in Ipoh, Malaysia [2022 Updated]

sources.snippet: Located at Gunung Rapat, Ling Sen Tong Temple is a charming Taoist temple located next door to Nam Thean Tong and Sam Poh Tong. The temple comprises of several attractive statues of different characters and deities from the Chinese folklore and Chinese mythology.
sources.shortName: 33 Best Places to visit in Ipoh | Top Tourist Attractions

places.name: Ling Sen Tong Temple

reviews.text: Really quiet and beautiful place. No one hassles you, and entry is free (donations are always welcome). Definitely recommend visiting if you're in Ipoh-there are two other temples right next to it.

Great place to stop and check out one of the more well known cave temples that Ipoh is famous for. Just off the highway and close enough to the town centre. Lots of deputies represented there - can be a bit hard to differentiate due to the lighting and intense incense smoke residue. Best to avoid during Taoist anniversary celebrations if you have breathing issues
Beautiful temple with statues and gardens. Definitely worth a visit. Also next to other amazing temples to see

places.generalDescription: Funtasy House Trick Art in Ipoh, Perak is a vibrant and entertaining attraction featuring over 20 illusionistic rooms and artworks designed for fun trick photo sessions. The museum showcases more than 30 interactive murals where visitors can take pictures with the assistance of staff to achieve captivating and amusing images. With its lighthearted atmosphere, the museum promises an enjoyable experience as guests engage in creating comical poses for their photos.

sources.snippet: If you are on holiday in Ipoh with your family & group, this destination is one of the ideal places to have fun together.. There are more than 30 interactive mural paintings displayed for visitors to take pictures. Just like in some other 3D Art Museum locations, the staff here will take you to visit each mural & help you take pictures in the right position to produce pictures that stand out & are interesting.
sources.shortName: Attractions - 1969 Business Suites

sources.snippet: A combination of fun and fantasy, Funtasy House Trick Art is a two-storey shophouse 3D-trick art gallery that opened in Ipoh back in 2015. This art house is filled with over 30 mind-boggling paintings all made entirely by local artists. It even has upside-down rooms and themes that would look good on anyoneâ€™s feed!
sources.shortName: Ipoh Isn't Just Famous for Food, Here are 7 Stunning Places That'll Slay Your Insta Feed

sources.snippet: Funtasy House is an amazing trick art gallery in Ipoh, featuring a number of 3D murals and drawings. The gallery was opened in November 2015 and consists of twenty 3D exhibits to create visual illusion for fun and fantasy. The gallery is still a work in progress but draws a lot of visitors.
sources.shortName: 25 Places to Visit in Ipoh, Tourist Places & Top Attractions

sources.snippet: Funtasy House Trick Art is one of the most interesting places in Ipoh. Located in Ipoh Old Town, Funtasy House Trick Art is an art museum that consists of more than 20 trick arts painted by local artists. This is a great place to take fun photos with your family and friends.
sources.shortName: 28 Interesting places in Ipoh, Malaysia [2022 Updated]

sources.snippet: And the Funtasy House Trick Art has taken the reputation one step further. It is a gallery with unique and spectacular murals and paintings. Although the gallery is new (opened in 2015) and they have more attractions to add, they still, have thousands of visitors here.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh

sources.snippet: The Funtasy House Trick Art allows you to take some rather goofy and funny pictures with their optical illusions. This rather new tourist destination just opened not too long ago in November 2015, and itâ€™s absolutely a fun time.
sources.shortName: 10 Insta-worthy Spots In Ipoh You Should Check Out

places.name: Funtasy House Trick Art

reviews.text:
Fun Visit to Funtasy House Trick Art!

I had a great time at Funtasy House Trick Art! The 3D art and illusions were really fun to interact with, and it made for some awesome photos. Each room had a different theme, so there was always something new to try. The staff was friendly and helped us get the best shots, which was super helpful. It's a fun place to visit if you like unique photos and cool visual tricks â€“ perfect for a day out with friends or family

The owners/ receptionist were truly kind and friendly. However, the fantasy house itself was pretty run down, dim lighting, only a few spots or rooms with air conditioning. Two strorey high with limited activities for little ones. You can be done with the whole place in about 15 minutes. Overall, it was a good experience, but it is certainly a one-time thing.

Funtasy House Trick Art in Ipoh is a great destination for those looking for a fun and unique experience. The house is filled with over 38 pieces of trick art, specially designed and painted by local professional 3D artists. This interactive exhibit is perfect for creating memorable and creative photo opportunities. You are encouraged to interact with the artwork, posing in different ways to create funny and shareable photos. Only problem with the staff, sure we came together with the child. They just remind us to keep quiet and not make a fuss. We only take pictures, do not damage anything or paintings. Haiya!!!

places.generalDescription: 22 Hale Street Heritage Gallery, located in Ipoh, Perak, is a beautifully restored heritage building that was officially opened by the Sultan of Perak in 2019. Originally intended for conservation and restoration, the project evolved to preserve the spirit of the place with a fresh outlook. The gallery is housed in two restored townhouses and showcases the history of Ipoh through artifacts, pictures, vintage furniture, gramophones, and modern historical objects. It also hosts regular pop-up events and exhibitions.

sources.snippet: The 22 Hale Street buildings are two old shops transformed into a museum and cafe. The heritage gallery displays the Ipoh lifestyles over time, including a lot of retro items.There is an entrance fee with a ticket, but this seems to change depending on the exhibition.
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 9 Best Things To Do in Ipoh, Malaysia (Updated 2025)

sources.snippet: If youâ€™re willing to learn something new and exclusive about Ipoh, you have to visit 22 Hale Street. Itâ€™s a museum and cafe that used to be two old shops. The museum shows the history of tin mining and the development of Ipoh during the British period.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh
21 Best Things To Do In Ipoh (Places That You Shouldn't Miss!)
Top Things To Do In Ipoh, Malaysia's Hipster Hotspot

places.name: 22 Hale Street Heritage Gallery

reviews.text: Fascinating look into part of Ipoh's Chinese past. Excellent audio guide. Friendly staff. Peranakan room was especially interesting. Temporary art gallery space featured ceramics artists. Nice gift shop. Award-winning bathroom!

It's a very nice and well maintained space with lots of photo opportunities. The audio guide is clear and easy to use too

And the souvenir shop is 5 stars! There's a lot of reasonably priced unique finds made by social organizations. Shopping for a good cause

Cultural art centre in the heart of Ipoh which reclaimed the once derelict building.
Loved the Art exhibition which reflects the very heart of Ipoh's beautiful architecture & heritage. Cute little gift shop (minimal range of goods)
Ideally situated adjacent to great eateries.

places.address: 22, Jalan Tun Sambanthan, 30000 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Kong Heng Square Artisan Market is a popular spot in Ipoh, Malaysia. The market offers a unique shopping experience with its retro-style shops and stores, featuring handicrafts, antiques, jewels, ornaments, and clothing. Visitors can also enjoy the famous 'white coffee' and other local cuisines at Kong Heng Kopitiam. The market's surroundings are characterized by orange bricks, faded mural paintings, old wooden windows, and vines entwining around the walls and roof.

sources.snippet: Locals are proud of this location as it is now a major attraction among both locals and foreigners where they come to enjoy its unique and atmospheric environment. The artisan market sets up many booths and small shops selling handicrafts and art decor, whereas a number of hipster cafes are also opened around the area. Kong Heng Square has been revitalised with a rustic blend of old and new architecture along with shandy trees, giving an ideal photo-worthy spot for Instagrammers.
sources.shortName: Ipoh Isn't Just Famous for Food, Here are 7 Stunning Places That'll Slay Your Insta Feed

sources.snippet: A post shared by Why Not Elephants, Ipoh (@why_not_elephants). If you are looking for a place to do shopping and support local artists, then there is no better place to do so than at Kong Heng Square Market. As one of the newest attractions in Ipoh, this market sells a variety of handcrafted items such as pillows, jewelry, books, and other accessories.
sources.shortName: 25+ BEST Things To Do In Ipoh: Top Attractions Of 2024

sources.snippet: Not to be confused with Concubine Lane, Kong Heng Square is another magical place of its own. The old and nostalgic elements of the place remain until today with the roots and trees encircling the buildings, truly a beautiful crossover between modernisation and nature. Donâ€™t forget to slow down and appreciate the true beauty of it all!
sources.shortName: 10 Beautiful Spots In Ipoh Worth Travelling The Miles For

sources.snippet: Situated in a 3-storey neoclassical building that houses number of Instagram-worthy cafes, a barbershop, a library and an inner courtyard with stairway leading to the guest rooms. This heart of old-town Ipoh still retains some of the nostalgic charm true to the times. Address: 74, Jalan Bandar Timah, 30000 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia
sources.siteName: TheSmartLocal - Singapore's Leading Travel and Lifestyle Portal
sources.shortName: 14 Unknown Instagrammable Locations In Ipoh For The Perfect #POTD

sources.snippet: This is also where you can find Ipohâ€™s trendiest cafe, Plan B. Plan Bâ€™s modern industrial exterior goes well together with its surroundings â€“  the grungy brick walls with overgrown vegetation. Besides searching for the best angle for your Instagram photos, you can have a look at the stalls set up outside of Plan B.
sources.shortName: Instagram Worthy Spots In Ipoh For A Memorable Time And Photo

sources.snippet: A post shared by Steffi Sarge Kaur (@steffisidhu) on Sep 23, 2017 at 3:15am PDT. A post shared by NgaiHwei Chai (@ngaihweichai) on Aug 25, 2017 at 12:28am PDT. If youâ€™re aiming for a place with retro vibes, Kong Heng Square, which has a mixed modern and retro decoration is a perfect place for you!
sources.shortName: Boost Your IG Account With Beautiful Photos at these Gorgeous Spots in Ipoh

sources.snippet: Introducing Kong Heng Square Artisanal Market, nestled quietly at the corner of Panglima Road. It is so quiet that some may not notice the space. However, Kong Heng Square is also no stranger to many visitors in Ipoh.
sources.shortName: 15 Things To Do in Ipoh (Morning till Night)

sources.snippet: Kong Heng Square Artisan Market is lovely and picture-perfect. The market is full of spots, where you can pose and have your most-liked Instagram photos. Check out the rustic walls and windows around this place.
sources.shortName: 32 Stunning Instagram Spots in Ipoh (With Exact Location!)

sources.snippet: A post shared by Anas Ridzuan (@anasridzuan) on Aug 22, 2018 at 11:47pm PDT. View this post on Instagram. A post shared by Aryl (@aryl_je) on Nov 10, 2019 at 7:10pm PST
sources.shortName: 8 Photo-Worthy Spots to Take Instagrammable Photos in Ipoh

sources.snippet: On weekends, Kong Heng Square is a small but interesting space to explore close to Concubine Lane. You can pick up local handicrafts from the small artisan stalls here.
sources.shortName: 21 Best Things To Do In Ipoh (Places That You Shouldn't Miss!)
Top Things To Do In Ipoh, Malaysia's Hipster Hotspot

places.name: Kong Heng Square

reviews.text:
Kong Heng Square, a charming blend of heritage and modern creativity. Nestled in the heart of the old town, it is filled with boutique shops, artisanal cafÃ©s, and quirky street art. The atmosphere is vibrant yet laid-back, making it a great place to explore on a lazy afternoon, everyday!

The restored colonial-era buildings is filled with nostalgic touch, while places like Plan B cafÃ© and the various pop-up stalls keep things fresh and contemporary. Whether you're hunting for unique souvenirs, enjoying local desserts, or simply soaking in the artsy vibes, Kong Heng Square is definitely worth a visit. Perfect for photographers like me, foodies, and anyone who loves a mix of old and new.

âš ï¸âš ï¸Welcome to my honest review âš ï¸âš ï¸

I think is okay for first timers to visit. Nothing much honestly. Just a few gift shops and nothing much. Quite a small area. Some corners can be Instagram worthy other than that is nothing much

It's a quite normal place that if you want to buy some souvenirs only
And there's a plan b cafe beside of it
Not really worth the visit if you come here purposely since we visit there after visiting the concubine lane

places.address: 75a, Jalan Bandar Timah, 30000 Ipoh, Perak, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Ipoh, Tasik Cermin 2 is a hidden gem that captivates visitors with its breathtaking beauty. Often referred to as Mirror Lake due to its stunning reflections, this secret lake is encircled by majestic limestone karsts, creating an enchanting atmosphere. To reach this picturesque spot, adventurers must traverse a narrow tunnel over 100 meters long before emerging into the serene waters.

sources.snippet: Tasik Cermin in Gunung Rapat is a lake that is completely surrounded by limestone hills. So if you want to go to this lake, visitors need to go through a tunnel by walking 30-40 m. Once you cross the door of this cave, you will be in another world with the beauty of the lake surrounded by green trees & limestone hills.
sources.shortName: Attractions - 1969 Business Suites

sources.snippet: Located near the Sam Poh Tong Cave Temple, Tasik Cermin or â€˜Mirror Lakeâ€™ is a hidden gem in Ipoh, not many people know about this beautiful lake. The uniqueness of this lake is its limestone karst towers which make the lake so attractive. Here you can admire the view of this peaceful lake and take pictures of it.
sources.shortName: The Top 26 Best places to visit in Ipoh, Explore the best of Ipoh

sources.snippet: As the sun begins to set and the air becomes cooler, no better place in Ipoh than Tasik Cermin to have a chill stroll. This place is a hidden forest-like gem that is surrounded by limestone karst formations, it feels like a movie!
sources.shortName: 15 Things To Do in Ipoh (Morning till Night)

sources.snippet: Experience Ipohâ€™s best-hidden gems: a secret lake named Tasik Cermin. The lakeâ€™s setting, surrounded by limestone karsts, is truly unique and has been given the nickname â€˜Mirror Lakeâ€™.
sources.siteName: Salt in our Hair Travel Blog
sources.shortName: 9 Best Things To Do in Ipoh, Malaysia (Updated 2025)

places.name: Tasik Cermin 2

reviews.text: A hidden gem in Ipoh! Tasik Cermin offers a breathtakingly scenic spot to explore. The boat ride through the cave leading to the crystal-clear lake was both adventurous and unforgettable. A truly serene and picturesque experience. This place is perfect for nature lovers and those seeking a peaceful escape.

Great little boat tour leading to a stunning lake. The trip includes a tunnel crossing of over 100 meters and lasts around 20 minutes. Super chill vibe, with chances to spot local goats drinking at the edge. Clear explanations in English, friendly staff. Highly recommended-especially compared to Lake 1, which isn't really worth it. Make sure to go before 11â€¯AM to catch the perfect light and mirror-like reflections on the water.

It was my first visit to Tasik Cermin 2 and I was quite intense awe of its beauty though there were some slight drawbacks. Highlights and tips:
- There is an entrance fee of RM4 for Malaysians with an identity card and RM12 for foreigners. Tickets are to be purchased at the entrance at a dedicated counter. Alternatively, can be purchased online 1 day before.
- Boat ride fees are a separate fee.
- To access the lake, visitors go through a tunnel to emerge at the lake. It is quite a sight to behold.
- Once out of the cave, it can be pretty hot and humid. I highly recommend wearing airy clothes suitable for the area and if possible, visit early in the morning when it opens for cooler air.
- The lake and surrounding areas is beautiful naturally. The area feels peaceful though when there are lots of people, it is still easy to get lost in its beauty.
- There is quite a number of parking spots for Tasik Cermin 2 but it is also shared with the nearby cafe, Kin Loong Chang Jiang Cafe. When we came, there were almost no available spots and this was about lunchtime.
- Data connection was quite spotty in the area.

There were a few things that fell short for this place:
- With the number of boat rides, the beauty of the surrounding mountains, trees & limestone surfaces is not reflected well anymore.
- Even on a weekday, it can get pretty crowded.
- Not everyone is very understanding and can just stand in front of your frame or block you from taking photos.
- It can get extremely hot.

It was a good visit and it did enjoy my time there except for some drawbacks. It would be a good first time visit though not quite sure with all the disrupted reflective views, it would require more for me to head back again.
